Comment: Welcome to /r/ask_politics.  Our goal here is to provide educated, informed, and serious answers to questions about the world of politics.  Our full [rules](https://www.reddit.com/r/Ask_Politics/wiki/rules) can be found here, but are summarized below.  * Address the question (and its replies) in a professional manner * Avoid personal attacks and partisan "point scoring" * Avoid the use of partisan slang and [fallacies](https://www.wikiwand.com/en/List_of_fallacies) * Provide sources if possible at the time of commenting.  **If asked, you must provide sources.** * Help avoid the echo chamber - downvote bad/poorly sourced responses, not responses you disagree with.  **Do not downvote just because you disagree with the response**. * Report any comments that do not meet our standards and rules.  If you have any questions, please contact the mods at any time.   *I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/Ask_Politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*

Comment: This is just a list I have been compiling-  * Building the economy from the middle out and the bottom up. * Biden is the first president since FDR to ensure high labor standards, enforcing rules against unfair labor practices, sides with the workers and labor unions and not the corporations. (Especially forced labor and child labor) * Investment of $500 Billion to the private sector for manufacturing and clean energy investments.More than 142,000 new clean energy jobs for electricians, mechanics, construction workers, technicians and support staff. This includes electric vehicle charging stations, fiber optic cable, and water infrastructure parts. Semiconductor (computer chips) plant in Kansas. * The first climate assessment in the last 30 years. In the last year alone natural disasters in America have caused $178 Billion in damages. * Tax credits to make your home more energy efficient, upgrading windows and doors, tax credits to install electric heat pumps and solar panels, and tax credits to buy electric vehicles. * 18 new offshore wind projects that will power more homes with clean energy. Making investments in the US offshore wind industry at the tune of 7.7 Billion. * Doubling the number of zero-emission buses, improvement on over 135,000roads and 8,000 bridges across the country, and largest investment in passenger rail. * His ongoing support for reproductive rights (Emergency Care, Birth Control, Medication, Access to Abortion, Access to Preventive Health Care, Health Insurance Coverage for all by Medicare Expansion) * Tried and is still in the courts to cancel $20,000 of student debt for each person who has a student loan. Made it easier to qualify for income based replacement plans. Easier to claim work in a public sector job. * Protected Marriage for LGBTQI and Interracial Couples. * The first meaningful gun violence reduction legislation in 30 years. Helps remove firearms from dangerous individuals, narrows the "boyfriend loophole" to keep guns out of the hands of convicted dating partners. Expands mental health services in schools and supports school safety. * Historic expansion of benefits and services for toxic exposed veterans. * Ending our failed approach to marijuana. Pardon of federal offenders and initiated the process to review how marijuana is scheduled. * Instrumental in hostage negotiations between Israel and Hamas
Author: Beneficial_Garden266
